metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9993 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
FFmpeg before 2.8.12, 3.0.x and 3.1.x before 3.1.9, 3.2.x before 3.2.6, and 3.3.x before 3.3.2 does not properly restrict HTTP Live Streaming filename extensions and demuxer names, which allows attackers to read arbitrary files via crafted playlist data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9993` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavformat57 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavresample3 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavutil55 - 7:3.2.6-1
libpostproc54 - 7:3.2.6-1
libswresample2 - 7:3.2.6-1
libswscale4 - 7:3.2.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.2.6-1').
